Question_3.Question: What are the two basic aspects determining the most important challenges in the development of laser transformation hardening?
Question_3.A: Control of the chemical composition and material density
Question_3.B: Determination of the workpiece dimensions and weight
Question_3.C: Control of the thermal field and optimization of the laser scanning strategy

Question_3.Source: The effective applicability of laser transformation hardening depends on two basic aspects that determine the most important challenges in the development of this manufacturing technology: an accurate determination and control of the thermal field occurring onto the workpiece and the optimization of the laser scanning strategy...

Question_4.Question: What is a key consideration in the simulation of laser hardening process?
Question_4.A: Predicting the carbon diffusion during the cooling phase
Question_4.B: Modeling the microstructure prediction during the heating phase
Question_4.D: Focusing on the quenching medium used
Question_4.Source: Theoretically, the process simulation requires the prediction of the thermal field in the target part, of the austenite formation, carbon diffusion and austenite homogenization and, finally, the microstructure prediction during the cooling.
